newsitem.title: USA: Nebraska cattle bid $110/dressed, passed - private.
newsitem.headline: Nebraska cattle bid $110/dressed, passed - private.

text.p: Nebraska feedlot cattle bids at $110.00 per cwt on a dressed basis were passed by owners pricing cattle at $112.00, market sources said.
The bulk of cattle last week sold at $109.00, although there were a few late Friday at $110.00, they said.
There were no reported bids on a live basis, with cattle seen priced from $69.00 to $70.00.

Fed cattle prices this week were expected to be underpinned by smaller numbers of market-ready cattle and strong packer demand. This week's showlist was estimated near 68,600 head, down 12,900 from last week, they said.
Last week's snowstorm and unseasonably cold temperatures hindered weight gains on cattle, spurring some owners to hold them back another week to recover following the storm, the market sources said.
